definitions.definition: To discharge; to end the employment or service of.
definitions.example: The company dismissed me after less than a year.
The soldiers were dismissed after the parade.

definitions.definition: To dispel; to rid one’s mind of.
definitions.example: He dismissed all thoughts of acting again.

definitions.definition: To reject; to refuse to accept.
To send or put away, to discard with disregard, contempt or disdain. (sometimes followed by as).
definitions.example: She dismissed him with a wave of the hand.

definitions.definition: To give someone a red card; to send off.
